newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-CRA sells Southern Copper assets.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-CRA sells Southern Copper assets.

text.p: The RTZ-CRA group said on Wednesday that it has sold the land, buildings, plant and equipment owned by its subsidiary company Southern Copper Ltd to the Port Kembla Copper group of companies for an undisclosed sum.
Kembla Copper is a joint venture between Japan's oldest copper smelter Furukawa Co Ltd, Nissho Iwai Corp, Itochu Corp and Nittetsu Mining Co Ltd.
A RTZ-CRA statement said Southern Copper operated a copper smelting and refining complex at Port Kembla, New South Wales. The complex has been on care and maintenance since early 1995.

The venture would renovate the plant so it can meet pollution regulations and boost its copper production capacity to 120,000 tonnes a year by the second half of 1998 from 80,000 tonnes currently, it said.
